item.title: Building your village
item.description: Inhabiting the same physical or virtual spaces can cause unplanned repeated interactions.

item.title: Happy accidents
item.description: We don’t make mistakes – we just have happy accidents. Bob Ross Serendipity can create new scenarios that an experienced person may not have otherwise come up with.

item.title: High skill ceilings allow for skill expression
item.description: A high skill ceiling rewards continuous optimization and innovation. When there is space to try all kinds of things, there are more possibilities for people to express their ability in ways that are unique to them.

item.title: Learning exhaust
item.description: Select quotes from https://www.swyx.io/learn-in-public/ make the thing you wish you had found when you were learning Wear your noobyness on your sleeve.

item.title: Low rank approximation
item.description: Human intuition Vertical slice Spitpaint Cognitive scaffolding

item.title: Low skill floor
item.description: Things with barriers to entry have a high skill floor.

item.title: Roguelike games cause happy accidents
item.description: Due to their generative nature, roguelike games can cause happy accidents during gameplay. Since every run is different, certain combinations of circumstances can flip the rules on what decisions are “good”.

item.title: Shortcomings of intention
item.description: Shortcomings of intention intention is WHAT someone is thinking when they do an action. for example, i say somethng to you with the intent of starting conversation.

item.title: Some communities lend themselves to unstructured teaching and mentorship
item.description: generally hobby communities are better about this than “professional” communities e.g. skateboarding has way fewer formal barriers to entry vs.

item.title: Startups are asymmetrical warfare
item.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skirmisher Skirmishers' open formations and smaller numbers can give them superior mobility over the regular forces, allowing them to engage only on favorable terms, taking advantage of better position or terrain, and quickly withdrawing from any threat of superior enemy forces.

item.title: Training your intuition
item.description: Many professionals in various feels have talked about relying on “feeling” over strictly adhering to rules. Rather than using predefined rules for decisionmaking, their approach to learning is to train your intuition.

item.title: Working with the garage door open
